title: The Future of Farming: Next-Level Machinery You NEED on Your Farm #shorts #farming  #machinery

subtasks: Sit in tractor seat
Operate steering wheel to guide tractor
Engage tractor hydraulics to lower mower blades
Monitor machine operation for malfunctions
Adjust blade height as necessary for cut depth
Check progress of hay cutting periodically
Drive tractor to baling location
Attach hay mower and baler to tractor
Operate baler to collect and form hay bales
Secure bales onto trailer or stacking them
Rinse off bales if necessary
Drive tractor to truck or trailer
Position bales or trailer near truck bed
Unload bales from trailer into truck bed
Secure bales in truck bed for transport
Back truck into hay storage area
Open truck or trailer tailgate
Release bales from truck bed to storage
Stack bales in storage area
Inspect baled hay for moisture content
Position bales to allow airflow between them
Cover bales with tarp or protective covering
Determine required cutting height based on hay type
Lower and raise mower blades to correct height
Monitor weather conditions to schedule hay cutting
Prepare tools and equipment for day's operations
Refuel equipment as needed
Lubricate and maintain equipment before use
Select appropriate mower attachment for pasture
Drive tractor to pasture area
Operate mower to cut grass and weeds
Check boundary for missed areas
Turn mower off and disconnect when done
